## Description
Require specifying the reason argument when using `@deprecated` directive

This rule checks the parameter of `@deprecated` directive for the use of reason argument,
suggesting user to add it in case the argument is missing.

## Examples

### Invalid

```graphql
query {
  member @deprecated
}
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.graphql:2:10 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-deprecated-reason">lint/nursery/useDeprecatedReason</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">The directive `@deprecated` should have a `reason` argument.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>query &#123;<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>2 │ </strong>  member @deprecated<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>         <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>3 │ </strong>&#125;<br />    <strong>4 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Add a `reason` argument to the directive.</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

### Valid

```graphql
query {
  member @deprecated(reason: "Why?")
}
```
